Text:
One optimization that I can think of is to apply [Dijkstra's algorithm](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dijkstra%27s_algorithm). This algorithm will give you a minimum (in your case maximum) path for a particular source node to all destination nodes. 

In this example, because you don't know the source node to start at, you will have to apply Dijkstra's algorithm for each node in the grid. The time complexity will be better than your recursion method because for a particular source node, when finding a maximum path Dijkstra's algorithm does not go through all the possible paths.

One optimization that I can think of is to apply [Dijkstra's algorithm](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dijkstra%27s_algorithm). This algorithm will give you a minimum (in your case maximum) path for a particular source node to all destination nodes. 

In this example, the first step would be to build a graph.

And because you don't know the source node to start at, you will have to apply Dijkstra's algorithm for each node in the grid. The time complexity will be better than your recursion method because for a particular source node, when finding a maximum path Dijkstra's algorithm does not go through all the possible paths.
